channel.title: I'm in a gang
channel.description:
Called Fresh University at my school. More of a clique than a gang though.
Here's how it went down. I got four books for college this semester. One of them is for my History Of Special Effects class. From the first special effects to the effects of 2007 in a HUGE ass book that looks sweet as hell. Explains everything almost. I really like this book. 75$
One of them is my geometry book. It's about a quarter of the size of the special effects book, but still 500 pages. 500 pages of words and triangles. 120$
Bullshit. Almost double price for that? Hell no. I thought it was a load of shit. So, after spending 350$ total on book, I got an idea looking at the receipt. All books can be turned in within a week in original condition with the receipt for full refund.
Here's how it goes. I said I was going to go home, and take a picture of each page in the book and put them on my computer, and then bring the book back for a refund. Then I offered to do it to others'.
One of them came up to me and was like damn you sure is a hustler and told me I could be in their clique cause they need someone to handle money and shiz.
So basically, I'm selling the geometry book in it's entirety for 20$ via internet, or 50$ if they want it printed out. They save anywhere from 100$ to 70$ and I make it.
I just finished getting all the pictures of every page, took about twenty minutes with a few breaks.

item.title: I'm in a gang
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Squigglyo, post:84, topic:236443”]private schools make kids obey the rules. Yes sir, no sir, please and thank you.

Its bullshit for raising people in the real world. These kind of kids are going to be the ones who are working in the higher paying jobs, BUT will be the spineless adults who lick there bosses ass every day.

I myself have only ever been to private schools, but seemed to be immune to there way of teaching. Somewhere between detentions, expulsions and computer lab explosions, they realised io wasnt ‘ass licker’ material and i then went to TAFE, the public school version of uni. And my god life was so much better.

i imagine that public schools are way more lax with rules, so a more friendlier enviroment, but also more dangerous if you [piss off the wrong kids.

So its all a matter of wether you want more fun and the ability to grow up well rounded, or more intelligence, but grow up robot like and without a spine.[/quote]
You can’t accurately generalize all private schools/their students like that, they vary greatly.
Of course, the same thing goes for public schools/pretty much anything.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm in a gang
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

The private schools here (in my town at least) are basically just religous schools, which are also free. They make you take a religion course each year, which is bullshit. We have a catholic school, and even worse, as french catholic school.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm in a gang
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

In sweden it does not make a change if you are from a private school or not. Many choose private-schools for the fact you have an option of changing your whole school-schedule, getting extra-courses/lessons and much more.

The people who go to them here are the same as the ones that go to regular schools.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm in a gang
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Drunkard you can’t just assume that most private schooled kids are like that.

But yeah. My girlfriend was homeschooled up until her senior year, and she’s not very sheltered at all. She fits in just as much as we do.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm in a gang
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[offtopic]
I once knew a kid [he wasn’t always home schooled] who went to the same camp as me for about 2 weeks. A different kid was punched in the face [he hit a grill on his way down, and got knocked out]. So, the crazy kid started CRYING. In between sobs, he yelled “I LIVE IN A SHELTERED ENVIRONMENT! I’VE NEVER SEEN SOMEONE GET PUNCHED BEFORE!”.
I have to admit, due to him and a few other crazies, that was the best camp I’ve ever been too. [George Bush was there. He told us to join the army.]

Read full topic

item.title: I'm in a gang
item.dc:creator: @Drunkard18 Drunkard18
item.description:
@Drunkard18 wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:77, topic:236443”][quote author=Drunkard18 link=topic=312023.msg2492879#msg2492879 date=1224223811]

[quote author=cooper link=topic=312023.msg2492877#msg2492877 date=1224223721]

Haha, sorry but i just have to comment on that: Private schools here are free too

Sorry for completely derailing the thread.
[/quote]Why have private schools then?

So the more intellectual students can be with others of their same mentality, and don’t have to go to school and have classes on things they already know and understand fully.

What are you basing that statement off of?
I know a lot of people who go to/have graduated from private schools in America and are not socially challenged at all.
[/quote]Seriously, you need to get some hard proof too.

It’s a school, not a mental institution… just going to school there isn’t going to make you socially challenged.

Private schools WILL fuck up a child’s ability to socialize with the average person, as most kids in private schools come from families who have more money then the average family, so they will most likely be used to more comfortable styles of living, thus, they will not be able to relate with the average person their age as much, also, since they are with students who have most likely been treated better by people, they will be softer, and expect to be treated better then the average person.

Not always. A lot of students are on scholarships, or can barely afford the tuition [at my school]. You’re right, but it’s not as bad/noticeable as you would think. The expectation part really changes from person to person, though.

Yes, and i believe that many private school students would be able to make it in life without too many social problems, and in my personal opinion, it’s homeschooling that really fucks people up socially.

I knew a kid who was home schooled… he was too nice. It was creepy, he never said anything mean or made fun of anyone.[/quote]
as have i, this kid knew no truths of sex or drugs, and didn’t know what an erection was, how fucked up is this shit?

then again he was a christian, which in turn was his first problem.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm in a gang
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Squigglyo, post:70, topic:236443”]ok, ive slept thru several uni semesters myself and i know expensive the reading materials would, in theroy, be.

But… a gang… called Fresh University…selling black market books…

The entire concept of the idea itself would sound so much more cooler if you didnt try and pawn it off like you where the bad boys of uni who where likely to cap people if they muscled in on your… book territory. Treat it like a scam… not a gang handling black market books.

But otherwise, solid idea. i myself would have done it if i had actualy needed to purchase the books, but 90% of the classes i actualy attended, the materials where online… such a rip for the books.[/quote]

Okay I kinda already explained it’s not a gang. It’s more of a clique. And the gang has nothing to do with the books. I’ll sell some of them some books. But that’s not the purpose of it. If they ever need anything done with money I’m their man.

The books is my own thing.

Read full topic
